quieren'''|| || they want (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) quieren''' || || you want (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''tener''' || {{SbcInf}} || to have |- |align="right"| '''(yo) tengo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I have |- |align="right"| '''(tú) tienes''' || || you have (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) tiene''' || || he/she(/it) has |- |align="right"| '''(usted) tiene''' || || you have (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) tenemos'''|| || we have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) tenéis'''|| || you have (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) tienen'''|| || they have (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) tienen''' || || you have (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ser''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) soy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) eres''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) es''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) es''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) somos'''|| || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sois'''|| || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) son'''|| || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) son''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''Quiero el pastel de chocolate.''' | I want the chocolate cake. | '''Está bien.''' | That's fine. | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''No, no tiene.''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''¿Segura? Porque soy alérgico.''' | Are you sure? Because I am allergic. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''Quiero el pastel de chocolate.''' | I want the chocolate cake. | '''Está bien.''' | That's fine. | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''No, no tiene.''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''¿Segura? Porque soy alérgico.''' | Are you sure? Because I am allergic. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | I want the chocolate cake. | '''Quiero el pastel de chocolate.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''No, no tiene.''' | Are you sure? Because I am allergic. | '''¿Segura? Porque soy alérgico.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I want the chocolate cake. | '''Quiero el pastel de chocolate.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''No, no tiene.''' | Are you sure? Because I am allergic. | '''¿Segura? Porque soy alérgico.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | I want the three cream cake. | '''Quiero el pastel de tres leches.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have carrot? | '''¿El pastel tiene zanahoria?''' | No, it doesn't have any. It has apple. | '''No, no tiene. Tiene manzana.''' | No! I'm allergic to ({{=}} '''a''') the apples. | '''¡No! Soy alérgico a las manzanas.''' | The apple cake has no apple. | '''El pastel de manzana no tiene manzana.''' | Are you sure? The apple cake has no apple? | '''¿Segura? ¿El pastel de manzana no tiene manzana?''' | It has no apple. The three cream cake has apple. | '''No tiene manzana. El pastel de tres leches tiene manzana.''' | Fine. | '''Bien.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | I want the three cream cake. | '''Quiero el pastel de tres leches.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have carrot? | '''¿El pastel tiene zanahoria?''' | No, it doesn't have any. It has apple. | '''No, no tiene. Tiene manzana.''' | No! I'm allergic to ({{=}} '''a''') the apples. | '''¡No! Soy alérgico a las manzanas.''' | The apple cake has no apple. | '''El pastel de manzana no tiene manzana.''' | Are you sure? The apple cake has no apple? | '''¿Segura? ¿El pastel de manzana no tiene manzana?''' | It has no apple. The three cream cake has apple. | '''No tiene manzana. El pastel de tres leches tiene manzana.''' | Fine. | '''Bien.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | We want the chocolate cake. | '''Queremos el pastel de chocolate.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''No, no tiene.''' | Are you sure? (masculine) Because I am allergic. (feminine) | '''¿Seguro? Porque soy alérgica.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | We want the chocolate cake. | '''Queremos el pastel de chocolate.''' | That's fine. | '''Está bien.''' | Does the cake have nuts? | '''¿El pastel tiene nueces?''' | No, it doesn't have any. | '''No, no tiene.''' | Are you sure? (masculine) Because I am allergic. (feminine) | '''¿Seguro? Porque soy alérgica.''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0102

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Where Is the Restroom?|id=A0102}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} One of the most important survival techniques: asking for the bathroom. Everyone who has been in the situation knows what I'm talking about. The keyword of the lesson is '''baño''' – bathroom. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0004|A0004: She's not Mexican]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0035|A0035: Is anyone in there?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0112|A0112: What is your telephone number?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Where is the restroom?|id=A0102|dialogueid=A0102 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Disculpe! ¿Dónde está el baño?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''La segunda puerta a la derecha.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''De nada.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Disculpe!''' || '''¿Dónde''' || '''está''' || '''el''' || '''baño?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) excuse'' || ''where'' || ''(it) is'' || ''the'' || ''bathroom'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| Excuse me! Where is the bathroom? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''La''' || '''segunda''' || '''puerta''' || '''a''' || '''la''' || '''derecha.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''the'' || ''second'' || ''door'' || ''to'' || ''the'' || ''right'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| The second door on the right. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''Thanks.'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Thank you. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''De''' || '''nada.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0102 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''of'' || ''nothing'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| You're welcome. |- |}
[[Image:Textura.jpg|thumb|right|'''la puerta''' – the door|140px]] [[Image:Znak C-2.svg|thumb|right|'''a la derecha''' – to the right|100px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''disculpar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to excuse, to pardon |- || '''¡(usted) disculpe!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) excuse! (formal, singular) |- || '''¿dónde?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || where? |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) está''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''el baño''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the bathroom |- || '''segundo/segunda''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || second |- || '''la puerta''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the door |- || '''a''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || to |- || '''la derecha''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the direction right |- || '''a la derecha''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || on/to the right |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''nada''' || {{SbcPronoun}} || nothing |- || '''de nada''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || it's nothing, your're welcome |- |}
[[Image:Eñe on keyboard - blue.jpg|thumb|right|'''la eñe''' – the ñ|100px]] ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''la eñe''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the letter ñ (n with tilde) |- || '''los servicios''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the bathroom |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- || '''hasta mañana''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || until tomorrow |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''disculpar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to excuse |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) disculpa!''' || {{SbcImp}} || (you) excuse! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) disculpe!''' || || (you) excuse! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) disculpemos!''' || || (let's) excuse! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) disculpad!''' || || (you) excuse! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) disculpen!''' || || (you) excuse! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''primero/primera''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || first |- |align="right"| '''primer''' || ''before masculine nouns''|| first |- |align="right"| '''segundo/segunda''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || second |- |align="right"| '''tercero/tercera''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || third |- |align="right"| '''tercer''' || ''before masculine nouns''|| third |- |align="right"| '''cuarto/cuarta''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || fourth |- |align="right"| '''quinto/quinta''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || fifth |- |align="right"| '''sexto/sexta''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || sixth |- |align="right"| '''séptimo/séptima''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || seventh |- |align="right"| '''octavo/octava''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || eighth |- |align="right"| '''noveno/novena''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || ninth |- |align="right"| '''décimo/décima''' || {{SbcNumberMF}} || tenth |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Disculpe! ¿Dónde está el baño?''' | Excuse me! Where is the bathroom? | '''La segunda puerta a la derecha.''' | The second door on the right. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. | '''De nada.''' | You're welcome. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Disculpe! ¿Dónde está el baño?''' | Excuse me! Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Excuse me! Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Excuse me! Where is the bathroom? | '''¡Disculpe! ¿Dónde está el baño?''' | The second door on the right. | '''La segunda puerta a la derecha.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' | You're welcome. | '''De nada.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Excuse me! The bathroom? Where is it? | '''¡Disculpe! ¿El baño? ¿Dónde está?''' | The bathroom is on the right. | '''El baño está a la derecha.''' | Where? | '''¿Dónde?''' | The second door. | '''La segunda puerta.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' | You're welcome. | '''De nada.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Excuse me! The bathroom? Where is it? | '''¡Disculpe! ¿El baño? ¿Dónde está?''' | The bathroom is on the right. | '''El baño está a la derecha.''' | Where? | '''¿Dónde?''' | The second door. | '''La segunda puerta.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' | You're welcome. | '''De nada.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Excuse me! Where is the bathroom? (informal) | '''¡Disculpa! ¿Dónde está el baño?''' | The second door on the right. | '''La segunda puerta a la derecha.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' | You're welcome. | '''De nada.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Excuse me! Where is the bathroom? (informal) | '''¡Disculpa! ¿Dónde está el baño?''' | The second door on the right. | '''La segunda puerta a la derecha.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' | You're welcome. | '''De nada.''' }}</includeonly>
<includeonly>===Image Credits=== *“Image:Znak C-2.svg” by Paweł Grzywocz (Public Domain) *“Image:Eñe on keyboard - blue.jpg” by Chamaeleon (Public Domain) *“Image:Signo Itzcuintli.png” from the Codex Laud (Public Domain)</includeonly> <noinclude>{{SbcNavigateSpanishPod|A0096|A0102|A0106}}</noinclude>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0106

revision.comment: [[WB:REVERT|Reverted]] edits by [[Special:Contributions/8.225.203.51|8.225.203.51]] ([[User talk:8.225.203.51|talk]]) to last version by Martin Kraus
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Room Service|id=A0106}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} This is the lesson for all the fans of room service! And the room service might be even better when you order in Spanish! The rest of us will learn how to order a hamburger, which can be pretty useful, too. The keyword is: '''servicio a la habitación''' – room service. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0003|A0003: At the bar]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0052|A0052: Smells good]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0096|A0096: I am allergic]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Room service|id=A0106|dialogueid=A0106 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Sí tenemos.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Quiero una hamburguesa.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Tiene''' || '''servicio''' || '''a''' || '''la''' || '''habitación?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) have'' || ''service'' || ''to'' || ''the'' || ''habitation'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| Do you have room service? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Sí''' || '''tenemos.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''yes'' || ''(we) have'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| We do have it. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Quiero''' || '''una''' || '''hamburguesa.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(I) want'' || ''a'' || ''hamburger'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| I want a hamburger. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Se''' || '''la''' || '''llevo''' || '''en''' || '''diez''' || '''minutos.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''(to) you'' || ''her (= it)'' || ''(I) bring'' || ''in'' || ''ten'' || ''minutes'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| I bring it to you in 10 minutes. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0106 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''Thanks.'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Thank you. |- |}
[[Image:Hotel-suite-living-room.jpg|thumb|'''la habitación''' – the room|160px]] [[Image:NCI Visuals Food Hamburger.jpg|thumb|'''la hamburguesa''' – the hamburger|160px]] [[Image:Gnome-appointment-soon.svg|thumb|'''diez minutos''' – ten minues|100px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''tener''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to have |- || '''(usted) tiene''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you have (formal, singular) |- || '''el servicio''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the service |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''la habitación''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the room |- || '''sí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || yes, indeed |- || '''(nosotros/-as) tenemos''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || we have |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want |- || '''(yo) quiero''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I want |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''la hamburguesa''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the hamburger |- || '''le''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) you (formal, singular) |- || '''lo/la''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || him/her(/it) |- || '''se la''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || her(/it) to you (formal, singular) |- || '''se lo''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || him(/it) to you (formal, singular) |- || '''llevar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to bring |- || '''(yo) llevo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I bring |- || '''en''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || in |- || '''diez''' || {{SbcNumber}} || ten |- || '''el minuto''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the minute |- || '''los minutos''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the minutes |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}

{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | Do you have room service? | '''Sí tenemos.''' | We do have it. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | Do you have room service? | '''Sí tenemos.''' | We do have it. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Do you have room service? | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you have room service? | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Do you have room service? | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | We don't have hamburgers. | '''No tenemos hamburguesas.''' | Do you have jalapeños? | '''¿Tiene jalapeños?''' | No, we don't have jalapeños. | '''No, no tenemos jalapeños.''' | Tacos? | '''¿Tacos? | No, we don't have tacos. | '''No, no tenemos tacos.''' | I want room service! | '''¡Quiero servicio a la habitación!''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. Thank you. | '''Se lo llevo en diez minutos. Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you have room service? | '''¿Tiene servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | I want a hamburger. | '''Quiero una hamburguesa.''' | We don't have hamburgers. | '''No tenemos hamburguesas.''' | Do you have jalapeños? | '''¿Tiene jalapeños?''' | No, we don't have jalapeños. | '''No, no tenemos jalapeños.''' | Tacos? | '''¿Tacos? | No, we don't have tacos. | '''No, no tenemos tacos.''' | I want room service! | '''¡Quiero servicio a la habitación!''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. Thank you. | '''Se lo llevo en diez minutos. Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Do you have room service? (formal, plural) | '''¿Tienen servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | We want a hamburger. | '''Queremos una hamburguesa.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. (formal, plural) | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you have room service? (formal, plural) | '''¿Tienen servicio a la habitación?''' | We do have it. | '''Sí tenemos.''' | We want a hamburger. | '''Queremos una hamburguesa.''' | I bring it to you in 10 minutes. (formal, plural) | '''Se la llevo en diez minutos.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0112

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=What Is Your Telephone Number?|id=A0112}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} This lesson is full of useful phrases: how to ask for a phone number, how to give one's phone number, how to say that you are going to call, etc. Moreover, Liliana and JP discuss differences between continents and generations with respect to phoning. And all that in just 13 minutes! The keyword had to be a bit shorter than usual: '''móvil''' – mobile. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0056|A0056: What time is the train?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0072|A0072: Here is my card]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0092|A0092: How old are you?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=What is your telephone number?|id=A0112|dialogueid=A0112 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''OK, te llamo en la noche.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Vale.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Cuál''' || '''es''' || '''tu''' || '''número''' || '''de''' || '''teléfono?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''what'' || ''(it) is'' || ''your'' || ''number'' || ''of'' || ''telephone'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| What's your phone number? |- |}
{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}{{SbcNewline}}:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Mi''' || '''número''' || '''de''' || '''móvil''' || '''es''' || '''el''' || '''seis,''' || '''cinco,''' || '''dos,''' || '''doce,''' || '''cincuenta y seis,''' || '''cincuenta y seis.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''my'' || ''number'' || ''of'' || ''cell phone'' || ''(it) is'' || ''the'' || ''six'' || ''five'' || ''two'' || ''twelve'' || ''fifty-six'' || ''fifty-six'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=12| My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''OK,''' || '''te''' || '''llamo''' || '''en''' || '''la''' || '''noche.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''OK'' || ''you'' || ''(I) call'' || ''in'' || ''the'' || ''night'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| OK, I call you at night. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Vale.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0112 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''worthy'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| Great. |- |}
[[Image:CellPhone.png|thumb|'''el móvil''' – the mobile phone|100px]] [[Image:I-56.svg|thumb|'''el número cincuenta y seis''' – the number 56|100px]]<noinclude> [[Image:El Pilar de Zaragoza Noche 2005-03-25.jpg|thumb|'''la noche''' – the night|160px]]</noinclude> ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''¿cuál?''' || {{SbcInterrogativePronoun}} || what?, which? |- || '''ser''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) es''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''tu''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || your (informal, singular) |- || '''el número''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the number |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''el teléfono''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the telephone |- || '''mi''' || {{SbcPossessiveAdjective}} || my |- || '''el móvil''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the mobile phone |- || '''el/la''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || the |- || '''seis''' || {{SbcNumber}} || 6 |- || '''cinco''' || {{SbcNumber}} || 5 |- || '''doce''' || {{SbcNumber}} || 12 |- || '''cincuenta y seis''' || {{SbcNumber}} || 56 |- || '''OK''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || OK |- || '''te''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || you (informal, singular) |- || '''llamar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || too call |- || '''(yo) llamo''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I call |- || '''en''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || in |- || '''la noche''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the night |- || '''valer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be worth |- || '''vale''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || great, OK |- |}
===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| || '''igual''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || equal |- || '''el cellular''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the cell phone |- || '''el cell''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the cell phone |- || '''el número de cellular''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || the cell phone number |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | What's your phone number? | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''OK, te llamo en la noche.''' | OK, I call you at night. | '''Vale.''' | Great. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | What's your phone number? | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''OK, te llamo en la noche.''' | OK, I call you at night. | '''Vale.''' | Great. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | What's your phone number? | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, I call you at night. | '''OK, te llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's your phone number? | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, I call you at night. | '''OK, te llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | What's your phone number? | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, OK! 6, ...? | '''¡Vale, vale! Seis, ...?''' | It's the 6-52-... | '''Es el seis, cincuenta y dos, ... | 6-52 or ({{=}} o) 6-5-2? | '''¿Seis, cincuenta y dos o seis, cinco, dos?''' | It's the same. | '''Es igual.''' | OK. | '''Vale.''' | The number is 6-5-2-1-2-5-6-5-6. OK? | '''El número es el seis, cinco, dos, uno, dos, cinco, seis, cinco, seis. ¿Vale?''' | OK. I call you tonight. | '''Vale, te llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's your phone number? | '''¿Cuál es tu número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, OK! 6, ...? | '''¡Vale, vale! Seis, ...?''' | It's the 6-52-... | '''Es el seis, cincuenta y dos, ... | 6-52 or ({{=}} o) 6-5-2? | '''¿Seis, cincuenta y dos o seis, cinco, dos?''' | It's the same. | '''Es igual.''' | OK. | '''Vale.''' | The number is 6-5-2-1-2-5-6-5-6. OK? | '''El número es el seis, cinco, dos, uno, dos, cinco, seis, cinco, seis. ¿Vale?''' | OK. I call you tonight. | '''Vale, te llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | What's your phone number? (formal) | '''¿Cuál es su número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, I call you at night. (formal) | '''OK, lo/la llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's your phone number? (formal) | '''¿Cuál es su número de teléfono?''' | My cell phone number is 6-5-2-12-56-56. | '''Mi número de móvil es el seis, cinco, dos, doce, cincuenta y seis, cincuenta y seis.''' | OK, I call you at night. (formal) | '''OK, lo/la llamo en la noche.''' | Great. | '''Vale.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Do You Want a Mint?|id=A0116}}</noinclude> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} The topic of this lesson is irregular breath and how to deal with it. Our keyword is also irregular: '''huele''' – it smells from the irregular verb '''oler''' – to smell. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0016|A0016: I feel sick]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0052|A0052: Smells good]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0096|A0096: I am allergic]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Do you want a mint?|id=A0116|dialogueid=A0116 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Quieres una menta?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Sí, ¡toma!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 3}}</noinclude> |}
{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Quieres''' || '''una''' || '''menta?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(you) want'' || ''a'' || ''mint'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Do you want a mint? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué?''' || '''¿Me''' || '''huele''' || '''la''' || '''boca?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''why'' || ''(to) me'' || ''smells'' || ''the'' || ''mouth'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=5| Why? Does my mouth stink? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Sí,''' || '''¡toma!'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0116 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''yes'' || ''(you) take'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=2| Yes, take this! |- |}
[[Image:Cinnamon Tic Tac.jpg|thumb|'''la menta''' – the mint|160px]] [[Image:Mona_Lisa_detail_mouth.jpg|thumb|'''la boca''' – the mouth|160px]] ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''querer''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to want |- || '''(tú) quieres''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you want (informal, singular) |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''la menta''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the mint |- || '''¿por qué?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || why? |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''oler''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to smell |- || '''(él/ella) huele''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) smells |- || '''la boca''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the mouth |- || '''sí''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || yes |- || '''tomar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to take |- || '''¡(tú) toma!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || you take! (informal, singular) |- |}
===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- || '''hasta mañana''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || until tomorrow |- |}
{{SbcMoreVocabularySpanishPod}} {| |- |align="right"| '''querer''' || {{SbcInf}} || to want |- |align="right"| '''(yo) quiero''' || {{SbcPT}} || I want |- |align="right"| '''(tú) quieres''' || || you want (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) quiere''' || || he/she(/it) wants |- |align="right"| '''(usted) quiere''' || || you want (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) queremos'''|| || we want (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) queréis'''|| || you want (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) quieren'''|| || they want (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) quieren''' || || you want (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''oler''' || {{SbcInf}} || to smell |- |align="right"| '''(yo) huelo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I smell |- |align="right"| '''(tú) hueles''' || || you smell (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) huele''' || || he/she(/it) smells |- |align="right"| '''(usted) huele''' || || you smell (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) olemos'''|| || we smell (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) oléis'''|| || you smell (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) huelen'''|| || they smell (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) huelen''' || || you smell (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''tomar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to take |- |align="right"| '''¡(tú) toma!'''|| {{SbcImp}} || (you) take! (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) tome!''' || || (you) take! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) tomemos!''' || || (let's) take! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) tomad!''' || || (you) take! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) tomen!'''|| || (you) take! (formal, plural) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Quieres una menta?''' | Do you want a mint? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' | Yes, take this! }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Quieres una menta?''' | Do you want a mint? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' | Yes, take this! }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want a mint? | '''¿Quieres una menta?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take this! | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want a mint? | '''¿Quieres una menta?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take this! | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Take a mint! Do you want to? | '''¡Toma una menta! ¿Quieres?''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | For ({{=}} '''por''') the mouth. | '''Por la boca.''' | Does my breath smell? | '''¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take it! | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Take a mint! Do you want to? | '''¡Toma una menta! ¿Quieres?''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | For ({{=}} '''por''') the mouth. | '''Por la boca.''' | Does my breath smell? | '''¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take it! | '''Sí, ¡toma!''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Do you want a mint? (formal) | '''¿Quiere una menta?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take this! (formal) | '''Sí, ¡tome!''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Do you want a mint? (formal) | '''¿Quiere una menta?''' | Why? Does my mouth stink? | '''¿Por qué? ¿Me huele la boca?''' | Yes, take this! (formal) | '''Sí, ¡tome!''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Telephone Card|id=A0122}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} In this lesson Liliana and JP tell us all about phone cards, in particular how to buy one in Spanish—and why you should. The keyword is: '''tarjeta de teléfono''' – phone card. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0005|A0005: Take a picture]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0023|A0023: Going to the market]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0056|A0056: What time is the train?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Telephone card|id=A0122|dialogueid=A0122 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Internacionales.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Diez euros.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¿Me''' || '''da''' || '''una''' || '''tarjeta''' || '''de''' || '''teléfono?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(to) me'' || ''(you) give'' || ''a'' || ''card'' || ''of'' || ''telephone'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=6| Will you give me a phone card? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Para''' || '''llamadas''' || '''nacionales''' || '''o''' || '''internacionales?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''for'' || ''calls'' || ''domestic'' || ''or'' || ''international'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=5| For domestic or international calls? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Internacionales.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''international'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| International calls. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''Diez''' || '''euros.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''ten'' || ''euros'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=2| Ten euros. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Gracias.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0122 line 5}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''thanks'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=1| Thank you. |- |}
[[Image:10 Euro.Recto.png|thumb|'''diez euros''' – ten euros|220px]]
{{Wikipedia|euro}} ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''me''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- || '''dar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to give |- || '''(usted) da''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || you give (formal, singular) |- || '''un/una''' || {{SbcArticleMF}} || a |- || '''la tarjeta''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the card |- || '''de''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || of |- || '''el teléfono''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the telephone |- || '''para''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || for |- || '''la llamada''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the call |- || '''la llamadas''' || {{SbcNounPF}} || the calls |- || '''nacional''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || domestic |- || '''nacionales''' || {{SbcAdjectivePMF}} || domestic |- || '''internacional''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}}|| international |- || '''internacionales''' || {{SbcAdjectivePMF}} || international |- || '''diez''' || {{SbcNumber}} || ten |- || '''el euro''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the euro |- || '''los euros''' || {{SbcNounPM}} || the euros |- || '''gracias''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || thanks |- |}
{{Wikipedia|taco}} ===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''el taco''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the taco |- || '''la cerveza''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the beer |- || '''la pluma''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the pen |- || '''eu''' || {{SbcInterjection}} || yes |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

{| |valign="top"| {| |- ||      |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''uno''' || 1 |- |align="right"| '''dos''' || 2 |- |align="right"| '''tres''' || 3 |- |align="right"| '''cuatro''' || 4 |- |align="right"| '''cinco''' || 5 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''seis''' || 6 |- |align="right"| '''siete''' || 7 |- |align="right"| '''ocho''' || 8 |- |align="right"| '''nueve''' || 9 |- |align="right"| '''diez''' || 10 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''once''' || 11 |- |align="right"| '''doce''' || 12 |- |align="right"| '''trece''' || 13 |- |align="right"| '''catorce''' || 14 |- |align="right"| '''quince''' || 15 |- |} |valign="top"| {| |- |align="right"| '''dieciséis''' || 16 |- |align="right"| '''diecisiete''' || 17 |- |align="right"| '''dieciocho''' || 18 |- |align="right"| '''diecinueve''' || 19 |- |align="right"| '''veinte''' || 20 |} |valign="top"| <noinclude>{{Listen|filename=SpanishNumbers.ogg|title=SpanishNumbers.ogg |description=the numbers from 1 to 20|format=[[Ogg]]}}</noinclude> |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | Will you give me a phone card? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''Internacionales.''' | International calls. | '''Diez euros.''' | Ten euros. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | Will you give me a phone card? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''Internacionales.''' | International calls. | '''Diez euros.''' | Ten euros. | '''Gracias.''' | Thank you. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Will you give me a phone card? | '''¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | International calls. | '''Internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Will you give me a phone card? | '''¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | International calls. | '''Internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Will you give me a card? | '''¿Me da una tarjeta?''' | A card? | '''¿Una tarjeta? | For international calls. | '''Para llamadas internacionales.''' | A telephone card? | '''¿Una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | Yes ({{=}} '''sí''')! Will you give me a telephone card? | '''¡Sí! ¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono? | For international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas internacionales?''' | Yes, for international calls. | '''Sí, para llamadas internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Will you give me a card? | '''¿Me da una tarjeta?''' | A card? | '''¿Una tarjeta? | For international calls. | '''Para llamadas internacionales.''' | A telephone card? | '''¿Una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | Yes ({{=}} '''sí''')! Will you give me a telephone card? | '''¡Sí! ¿Me da una tarjeta de teléfono? | For international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas internacionales?''' | Yes, for international calls. | '''Sí, para llamadas internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Will you give us a phone card? | '''¿Nos da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | International calls. | '''Internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Will you give us a phone card? | '''¿Nos da una tarjeta de teléfono?''' | For domestic or international calls? | '''¿Para llamadas nacionales o internacionales?''' | International calls. | '''Internacionales.''' | Ten euros. | '''Diez euros.''' | Thank you. | '''Gracias.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.comment: moved link to audio to end of line
revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=Flirting|id=A0127}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} Liliana and JP talk about flirting in Latin America and Liliana demonstrates her most powerful weapons. As flirting requires continuous action, this is also the perfect opportunity to introduce the gerund, also known as the ing-form. The keyword is: '''coquetear''' – to flirt. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0001|A0001: Are you ready yet?]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0002|A0002: Birthday party]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0086|A0086: Are you single?]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=Flirting|id=A0127|dialogueid=A0127 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Mírala! Está coqueteando.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Te ve y te sonríe.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''¡Mírala!''' || '''Está''' || '''coqueteando.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''look at her'' || ''(she) is'' || ''flirting'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=3| Look at her! She is flirting. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Por qué?''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''why'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=1| Why? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Te''' || '''ve''' || '''y''' || '''te''' || '''sonríe.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''you'' || ''(she) sees'' || ''and'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(she) smiles'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=5| She looks at you and she smiles. |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Perfecto!''' || '''Voy''' || '''a''' || '''hablar''' || '''con''' || '''ella.''' <noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0127 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''perfect'' || ''(I) go'' || ''to'' || ''talk'' || ''with'' || ''her'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=6| Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. |- |}
[[Image:Raquel Nunes-3.jpg|thumb|right|'''está coqueteando''' – she is flirting|160px]] [[Image:Goya Maja ubrana2.jpg|thumb|right|'''te ve y te sonríe''' – she looks at you and she smiles at you|160px]] [[Image:Talk face.svg|thumb|right|'''hablar''' – to talk|120px]]<noinclude> [[Image:Learning to walk by pushing wheeled toy.jpg|thumb|right|'''caminar''' – to walk|120px]]</noinclude> ===Vocabulary for Dialogue=== :{| |- || '''la mujer''' || {{SbcNounF}} || the woman |- || '''el hombre''' || {{SbcNounM}} || the man |- || '''mirar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to look |- || '''¡(tú) mira!''' || {{SbcVerbImp}} || (you) look! (informal, singular) |- || '''la''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || her |- || '''¡(tú) mírala!''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || (you) look at her! (informal, singular) |- || '''estar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to be |- || '''(él/ella) está''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) is |- || '''coquetear''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to flirt |- || '''coqueteando''' || {{SbcVerbGer}} || flirting |- || '''está coqueteando''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || he/she(/it) is flirting |- || '''¿por qué?''' || {{SbcAdverb}} || why? |- || '''te''' || {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || you |- || '''ver''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to see |- || '''(él/ella) ve''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) sees |- || '''y''' || {{SbcConjunction}} || and |- || '''te''' || {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) you |- || '''sonreír''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to smile |- || '''(él/ella) sonríe''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || he/she(/it) smiles |- || '''perfecto/perfecta''' || {{SbcAdjectiveMF}} || perfect |- || '''ir''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to go |- || '''(yo) voy''' || {{SbcVerbPT}} || I go |- || '''a''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || to |- || '''hablar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to talk |- || '''voy a hablar''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || I'm going to talk |- || '''con''' || {{SbcPreposition}} || with |- || '''él/ella''' || {{SbcPronoun}} || him/her(/it) ''(after preposition)'' |- |}
===Vocabulary for Audio Lesson=== :{| |- || '''hablando''' || {{SbcVerbGer}} || talking |- || '''caminar''' || {{SbcVerbInf}} || to walk |- || '''caminando''' || {{SbcVerbGer}} || walking |- || '''hasta luego''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || see you later |- |}

(informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(usted) mire!''' || || (you) look! (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''¡(nosotros/-as) miremos!''' || || (let's) look! (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(vosotros/-as) mirad!''' || || (you) look! (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''¡(ustedes) miren!'''|| || (you) look! (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcDirectPronoun}} || me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''lo/la'''|| || you (formal, singular, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || them (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''los/las'''|| || you (formal, plural, m./f.) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''estar''' || {{SbcInf}} || to be |- |align="right"| '''(yo) estoy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I am |- |align="right"| '''(tú) estás''' || || you are (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) está''' || || he/she(/it) is |- |align="right"| '''(usted) está''' || || you are (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) estamos''' || || we are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) estáis''' || || you are (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) están''' || || they are (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) están''' || || you are (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ver''' || {{SbcInf}} || to see |- |align="right"| '''(yo) veo''' || {{SbcPT}} || I see |- |align="right"| '''(tú) ves''' || || you see (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) ve''' || || he/she(/it) sees |- |align="right"| '''(usted) ve''' || || you see (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) vemos'''|| || we see (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) veis'''|| || you see (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) ven'''|| || they see (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) ven''' || || you see (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''me'''|| {{SbcIndirectPronoun}} || (to) me |- |align="right"| '''te'''|| || (to) you (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''le'''|| || (to) you (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''nos'''|| || (to) us |- |align="right"| '''os'''|| || (to) you (informal, plural) |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) them |- |align="right"| '''les'''|| || (to) you (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''sonreír''' || {{SbcInf}} || to smile |- |align="right"| '''(yo) sonrío''' || {{SbcPT}} || I smile |- |align="right"| '''(tú) sonríes''' || || you smile (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) sonríe''' || || he/she(/it) smiles |- |align="right"| '''(usted) sonríe'''|| || you smile (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) sonreímos''' || || we smile (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) sonreís''' || || you smile (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) sonríen''' || || they smile (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) sonríen''' || || you smile (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''ir''' || {{SbcInf}} || to go |- |align="right"| '''(yo) voy''' || {{SbcPT}} || I go |- |align="right"| '''(tú) vas''' || || you go (informal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(él/ella) va''' || || he/she(/it) goes |- |align="right"| '''(usted) va'''|| || you go (formal, singular) |- |align="right"| '''(nosotros/-as) vamos''' || || we go (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(vosotros/-as) vais''' || || you go (informal, plural, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ellos/ellas) van''' || || they go (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''(ustedes) van''' || || you go (formal, plural) |- ||   || |- |align="right"| '''conmigo''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with me |- |align="right"| '''contigo''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with you (singular, informal) |- |align="right"| '''con él/ella''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with him/her(/it) |- |align="right"| '''con usted''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with you (singular, formal) |- |align="right"| '''con nosotros/-as''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with us (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''con vosotros/-as''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with you (plural, informal, m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''con ellos/ellas''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with them (m./f.) |- |align="right"| '''con ustedes''' || {{SbcPhrase}} || with you (plural, formal) |- |}
{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¡Mírala! Está coqueteando.''' | Look at her! She is flirting. | '''¿Por qué?''' | Why? | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | She looks at you and she smiles. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¡Mírala! Está coqueteando.''' | Look at her! She is flirting. | '''¿Por qué?''' | Why? | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | She looks at you and she smiles. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | Look at her! She is flirting. | '''¡Mírala! Está coqueteando.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | She looks at you and she smiles. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Look at her! She is flirting. | '''¡Mírala! Está coqueteando.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | She looks at you and she smiles. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | Look at her! She smiles at you. | '''¡Mírala! Te sonríe.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | She looks at you and she smiles at you. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | So what? ({{=}} and what?) | '''¿Y qué?''' | ¡She is flirting! | '''¡Está coqueteando!''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Look at her! She smiles at you. | '''¡Mírala! Te sonríe.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | She looks at you and she smiles at you. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | So what? ({{=}} and what?) | '''¿Y qué?''' | ¡She is flirting! | '''¡Está coqueteando!''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with her. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con ella.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | Look at him! He is flirting. | '''¡Miralo! Está coqueteando.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | He looks at you and he smiles. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with him. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con él.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | Look at him! He is flirting. | '''¡Miralo! Está coqueteando.''' | Why? | '''¿Por qué?''' | He looks at you and he smiles. | '''Te ve y te sonríe.''' | Perfect! I'm going to talk with him. | '''¡Perfecto! Voy a hablar con él.''' }}</includeonly>

revision.text:
<noinclude>{{SbcHeaderSpanishPod|title=I Miss Them|id=A0131}}</noinclude> {{SbcIntroductionSpanishPod}} In this lesson, JP and Liliana teach us how to ask what's wrong, how to express homesickness, how to give an advice, and how to approve of an idea. Well, not all possibilities but enough to get us started. The keyword is '''extraño''' – I miss. {{SbcSourceSpanishPod|[[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0030|A0030: Call back later]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0076|A0076: Jet-lag]], [[Spanish by Choice/SpanishPod newbie lesson A0096|A0096: I am allergic]]}} <noinclude>{{SbcAudioSpanishPod|title=I miss them|id=A0131|dialogueid=A0131 dialogue}}</noinclude> {{SbcDialogueSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Qué te pasa?'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Extraño a mi familia.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¡Llámalos!'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 3}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Buena idea.'''<noinclude>||align="right"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 4}}</noinclude> |- |}
{{SbcDialogueWithTranslationSpanishPod}} :{| |- |align="right"|''hombre:'' || '''¿Qué''' || '''te''' || '''pasa?'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 1}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| ||''what'' || ''(to) you'' || ''(it) happens'' |- |align="right"|''man:'' ||colspan=3| What's happening to you? |- |}
:{| |- |align="right"|''mujer:'' || '''Extraño''' || '''a''' || '''mi''' || '''familia.'''<noinclude>||align="right" valign="top" rowspan="3"|{{SbcAudioSpanishPodLine|id=A0131 line 2}}</noinclude> |- |align="right"| || ''(I) miss'' || ''to'' || ''my'' || ''family'' |- |align="right"|''woman:'' ||colspan=4| I miss my family. |- |}

{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcExercisesSpanishPod}} <noinclude>====Dialogue Translation==== Translate from Spanish to English. Click each bar to check your answer. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | What's happening to you? | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | I miss my family. | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Call them! | '''Buena idea.''' | Good idea. }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Translation==== Cover the right column, translate from Spanish to English and uncover the right column line by line to check your answers. If possible, read the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | What's happening to you? | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | I miss my family. | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Call them! | '''Buena idea.''' | Good idea. }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestion | What's happening to you? | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | I miss my family. | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | Call them! | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recall==== Now translate from English to Spanish. Remember to say the Spanish sentences aloud. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's happening to you? | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | I miss my family. | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | Call them! | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</includeonly> <noinclude>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestion | What's happening to you? | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | Well ({{=}} good) ... | '''Bueno ...''' | What? | '''¿Qué?''' | I miss my country and ({{=}} '''y''') the food. | '''Extraño mi país y la comida.''' | Well ... | '''Bueno ...''' | ¡And I miss my family! | '''¡Y extraño a mi familia!''' | Call them! | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Remix==== Translate this variant of the dialogue from English to Spanish. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's happening to you? | '''¿Qué te pasa?''' | Well ({{=}} good) ... | '''Bueno ...''' | What? | '''¿Qué?''' | I miss my country and ({{=}} '''y''') the food. | '''Extraño mi país y la comida.''' | Well ... | '''Bueno ...''' | ¡And I miss my family! | '''¡Y extraño a mi familia!''' | Call them! | '''¡Llámalos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</includeonly> {{SbcNewline2}}{{SbcNewline2}}<noinclude>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the [[#More Vocabulary|More Vocabulary]] section. {{SbcQuestion | What's happening to you? (formal) | '''¿Qué le pasa?''' | I miss my family. | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | Call them! (formal) | '''¡Llámelos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</noinclude><includeonly>====Dialogue Recast==== This translation exercise requires some of the words from the More Vocabulary section. {{SbcQuestionPrint | What's happening to you? (formal) | '''¿Qué le pasa?''' | I miss my family. | '''Extraño a mi familia.''' | Call them! (formal) | '''¡Llámelos!''' | Good idea. | '''Buena idea.''' }}</includeonly>

page.title: Using Wikibooks/Donating a Book to Wikibooks

revision.text:
{{Using Wikibooks/Page}}
== E-Book Authors ==
Wikibooks isn't the only resource on the web to find high-quality free ebooks. There are dozens of other large sites that offer them, and thousands of personal websites where authors offer up a book or two that they've written personally. Many people write books for a variety of reasons. Some people like to share the knowledge they've gathered. Some people like to help others. Some people are tired of answering questions from, and choose to put all the information in one place to answer all the questions at once. Regardless of the motivation, writing a book can be hard work, and maintaining it over time even more so. Donating a book you've written to Wikibooks can be a great move for many reasons:
# If your book is already freely available, Wikibooks and the [[GFDL]] license insures that it will always remain free. If your book is not yet free, you should always consider releasing it under a free license so other people can benefit from it. # Save yourself the bandwidth. Wikibooks servers are free to use and are completely supported by donations to the Wikimedia Foundation. # Save yourself the trouble. Server configurations hassles? DNS issues? Denial of service attacks? The Wikimedia Foundation employs a number of server technicians and software developers who deal with the technical headaches so you don't have to. # Wikibooks has hundreds of authors, editors, illustrators, and other contributors who can edit your book and keep it up-to-date. Tired of getting emails from readers with corrections and suggestions? Put it on Wikibooks and let them fix it themselves. # Wikibooks has print on demand publishing. Put your book on Wikibooks, create a [[Help:Collection]] from it, and have a few copies printed up. # Benefit from the Wikimedia Foundations massive integration. Your book can use material from Wikimedia Commons, import content from Wikipedia, and be used in a classroom through Wikiversity. That's just the start!
There are lots of reasons why existing e-books should be donated to Wikibooks, we hope you agree!
== Donating Books ==
If you've decided to donate a book to Wikibooks, you need to satisfy a few conditions first. There are a number of rules, requirements, and policies that must be followed to help keep Wikibooks a valuable high-quality free resource. If you have a book to donate, and need any help with it, you can always ask at the [[WB:RR|Reading Room]]. We also have a comprehensive list of policies on this issue listed at [[WB:DONATE]].
The first step is to make sure your book satisfies [[WB:WIW|Wikibooks inclusion criteria policy]]. Wikibooks is not a general purpose ebook host and books that do not conform to this policy may be deleted from Wikibooks. In short, here is a list of major requirements for books on Wikibooks:
# The book should be non-fiction, and usually should be academic. # The book should use a '''neutral point of view'''. # The book should not contain original research on a topic that has not been well-studied. # The book should be instructional. It should not just be a listing of facts and figures, or a series of unrelated articles. # Wikibooks is for textbooks, not for dictionaries, news reports, blogs, or other types of media. # The book should be released under the [[GFDL]].
=== The GFDL and Copyright Issues ===
The biggest hurdle to most donations is copyright issues. Wikibooks and all the books on it are licensed under the GFDL. The GFDL is a copy-left license with two major provisions:
# All authors to the book should be properly attributed. # All edits to the book must be released under the GFDL also. Therefore, all future versions of the book that are derived from the one on Wikibooks will always be released under the GFDL.
If you are an author of a book and you own the copyright to it, you can grant Wikibooks a license to use the book under the GFDL, and you can also grant other licenses to other people for it as well. As the copyright holder, you can grant as many licenses to use the material as you want. However the version at Wikibooks, and all future revisions of that version, will always be available under the GFDL. If the book is on Wikibooks, you can still host a copy on your own website, and you can print and sell the book too. You can also allow other websites to use your book under a different license too, if you want.
It's important to realize that once you grant Wikibooks a license to use your book under the GFDL, you can not take it back. The license is a contract, and you cannot break the contract unless Wikibooks violates the license in some way. Some authors want to put their book onto Wikibooks for a trial period, and then ask to have it taken down again. This cannot happen, once the book is on Wikibooks, it is there to stay. Be certain you want to donate the book to Wikibooks, because it cannot be undone afterwards.
If you are not the sole author of the book, or if you are not the originator or owner of all images in the book, you cannot donate it to Wikibooks without the permission of all copyright holders.
== Converting to Wikitext ==
Wikibooks uses Wikitext for its content, not LaTeX, or HTML, or DOCBOOK, or any other kind of markup or formatting. The biggest technical challenge to uploading a book to Wikibooks is that the book must be converted to Wikitext first, and then uploaded. This can be very difficult to do by hand, but several users have created tools and bots to help make the work easier. Ask for help at [[WB:TECH]].
